result.execSummary:
The defendant Leigh R. Lafler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution at an amount to be determined at a restitution hearing conducted by the Court Commissioner.

8/31/2015:  Restitution determined to be $43,282.00.

Pay costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Dawn and Brian Flowers or their business.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Write a letter of apology to Dawn and Brian Flowers.

Order for Furlough Release /s/ RJS 07/19/18
Motion for Furlough Release

Defendant Leigh R. Lafler in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner. Defendant Leigh R. Lafler appears in Custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:31 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Atty Mukoski states the appearances. 

Both counsel have received the Revocation Order and Warrant packet. 
There are no errors identified by either counsel. 
Court has reviewed the revocaton summary.  

Atty Mukoski makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Requests 9 months jail on Counts 2, 3, 4 and 8.  Requests 9 months jail on Count 9, consecutive to all other counts. 
Atty Roberts-Turner makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Requests that the 9 months jail run concurrent with the sentence that was imposed in Wood County on 6/26.  She believes there is 72 days credit.  Credit was determined by the Department of Corrections and that credit stops on the date of the sentencing of Wood County.  
Court notes that credit was determined by the Department of Corrections in the event he receives a letter with regards to credit on this matter from them. 

BY THE COURT: 
Restitution is converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. 

Counts 2, 3, 4 & 8 - 
Serve 9 months jail on each count.
72 days credit. 

Count 9 - 
Serve 6 months jail, consecutive to the 9 months on the other counts. 

Total jail sentence is 15 months. 
Eligible for huber. 
If he is found to be an appropriate candidate for electronic home monitoring, court does not have a problem with that after the defendant has served a total of 10 months. 

Pay costs that remain due and owing. 

Atty Roberts-Turner asks that the Judgment Of Conviction reflect that the sentence be served in another county if approved by the sheriff's of the counties.
BY THE COURT: Court does not object. 

Atty Roberts-Turner moves for furlough release for this weekend.  
Court questions where the defendant is being held. 
Atty Roberts-Turner indicates he is being held in Wood County by may be going to Waupaca County.  He is a resident of Portage County.  Apologizes for the late filing of the motion which she provided a copy to Atty Mukoski this morning.  His wife is terminally ill and due to his incarceration they are losing their housing and his wife received notice that they need to be out by this weekend in order to avoid forceable eviction on Monday.  Asks to furlough to move his family into his parents home. 
Atty Mukoski leaves it to the Court's discretion. 
BY THE COURT:  Court grants furlough thru Monday morning at 9:00 a.m.  Mr. Lafler is ordered to report and begin serving his sentences to the Portage County jail by 9:00 a.m. Monday morning (7/23/2018).
Court notes he does not have authority for the Wood County cases. 
Defendant indicates he understands the time to report.

Defendant Leigh R. Lafler in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:04 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 2, 3, 4, 8 & 9 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3, 4, 8 & 9.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 1, 5, 6 & 7 are dismissed and read-in. 
 
D.F. makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any counseling recommened by the agent.
Pay costs. 
Write a letter of apology to Dawn and Brian Flowers.
No contact with Dawn and Brian Flowers or their business. 
Pay restitution in an amount to be determined at a restitution hearing conducted by the Court Commissioner. 

Count 3 - 
Sentence withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 2. 
Pay costs.

Count 4 - 
Sentence withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 2 & 3. 
Pay costs.

Count 8 - 
Sentence withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 2, 3 & 4. 
Pay costs.

Count 9 - 
Sentence withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 2, 3, 4 & 8. 
Pay costs.
